thread.title: Cisco is buying AppDynamics, IPO is cancelled
thread.title_full: Cisco is buying AppDynamics, IPO is cancelled - Business Insider

author: Matt Weinberger
title: Cisco is buying AppDynamics, IPO is cancelled
text:
AppDynamics, which would have been the first big tech IPO of 2017 , is getting purchased by Cisco for $3.7 billion in cash and equity awards, according to a blog post . 
This is looking like a strong exit for AppDynamics: The San Francisco startup's IPO was looking to value the company at a maximum of $1.7 billion â€” less than its last private valuation of $1.9 billion . This means that Cisco is paying a considerable premium for the company, which makes products that help companies monitor and analyze their software.
According to the blog entry, AppDynamics CEO David Wadhwani will be staying on to run the company as a business unit of Cisco, under the umbrella of its "Internet of Things" business.
